subject: Web3
title: SIM Swap Attacks
description: A quick, practical guide to SIM Swap Attacks.

hook.text: A SIM swap lets attackers take over your phone number. With it, they can bypass two-factor authentication.

buildup.text: Attackers call your phone carrier, impersonate you, and transfer your number to their SIM card.

discovery.text: Once they have your number, they reset passwords, access exchange accounts, and drain your crypto in minutes.

twist.text: Carrier employees have been bribed to assist SIM swaps. The human element defeats even the best technical security.

climax.text: Hardware security keys and authenticator apps are the defense. Never rely on SMS for two-factor authentication.

punchline.text: Your phone number isn't secure. Attackers proved it thousands of times.

quiz.question: How do SIM swap attacks steal crypto?
options: By taking over your phone number to bypass two-factor authentication
